title: Revolution of Dignity - Wikipedia
snippet: The Revolution of Dignity (Ukrainian: Революція гідності, romanized: Revoliutsiia hidnosti), also known as the Maidan Revolution or the Ukrainian Revolution, took place in Ukraine in February 2014 at the end of the Euromaidan protests. Scores of protesters were killed by government ...

title: Ukraine - Maidan, Protest, Revolution | Britannica
snippet: Street protests erupted in Kyiv, and Lutsenko and Klitschko emerged as the leaders of the largest demonstrations since the Orange Revolution. Police violently dispersed crowds in Kyiv’s Maidan Nezalezhnosti (“Independence Square”), and, ...

title: Contemporary Ukraine in Revolution and Conflict (2004-2014) - The War in Ukraine - LibGuides at University of Connecticut
snippet: The Euromaidan Protests/Maidan Revolution/Revolution of Dignity/Revolution of Honour was a student protest movement that sought to force the pro-Kremlin Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych to sign an agreement of association with the European Union. title: Ukraine's revolution: Making sense of a year of chaos - BBC News
snippet: Ukrainian novelist Andrey Kurkov looks back on the tumultuous events of the last year, beginning with the Kiev protests and ending with civil war in the east.
